name: Jack Stapleton
description: A naturalist and schoolmaster who is revealed to be the villain manipulating the legend of the Baskerville hound to claim the family estate.

content.title: Background
content.body: Jack Stapleton initially appears as a mild-mannered naturalist and schoolmaster residing near Baskerville Hall. Secretly, he is Roger Baskerville, a long-lost relative with a clandestine agenda to inherit the Baskerville fortune by eliminating the heir. Using his scientific knowledge and cunning, he orchestrates a deceitful scheme involving the myth of a supernatural hound to instill fear and conceal his criminal actions.

content.title: Personality
content.body: Stapleton is characterized by his intelligence, duplicity, and manipulative nature. Outwardly polite and seemingly benevolent, he is revealed to be ruthless, opportunistic, and calculating. His demeanor conceals his darker ambitions and capacity for violence, making him a formidable adversary within the narrative.

content.title: Story Role
content.body: Stapleton serves as the primary antagonist in the novel. His plot to eliminate Sir Henry and claim the Baskerville estate drives the central conflict. His exploitation of the legendary hound creates suspense and misdirection, challenging Holmes’s deductive prowess to uncover the truth beneath supernatural pretenses.

content.title: Relationships
content.body: He poses as a friend and neighbor to Sir Henry, feigning goodwill to monitor and manipulate him. He has a secret familial connection to the Baskervilles and uses his knowledge of the moor and its wildlife to enact his plans. His sister, whom he controls, is also part of his deceptive household, adding further complexity to his façade.

content.title: Abilities / Skills
content.body: Stapleton is skilled in natural sciences and botany, which he leverages to cultivate poisonous plants and manage the hound trained for attacks. His knowledge of the moor and ability to disguise ulterior motives enable him to orchestrate an elaborate plot. His acting ability and psychological manipulation underscore his villainous role.
